title-group.article-title: A de novo mutation in PRICKLE1 in fetal agenesis of the corpus callosum and polymicrogyria

article-meta.aff: 1The University of Iowa, Department of Pediatrics, Pediatric Neurology, and Department of Neurology

author-notes.corresp: 2Corrresponding author. Send correspondence to: Elliott H. Sherr M.D. Ph.D., Professor of Neurology, Pediatrics, Institute of Human Genetics, University of California, San Francisco, 675 Nelson Rising Lane, San Francisco, CA 94158, Website: brain.ucsf.edu, (415) 514-9306 (ofc), (415) 502-8039 (lab), (415) 476-2723 (fax), Elliott.Sherr@ucsf.edu

abstract.p: Homozygous recessive mutations in the PRICKLE1 gene were originally reported in three consanguineous families with myoclonic epilepsy. Subsequently, several studies have identified neurological abnormalities in animal models with both heterozygous and homozygous mutations in PRICKLE1 orthologues, including epilepsy in flies and in mice with heterozygous PRICKLE1 mutations. We describe a fetus with a novel de novo mutation in PRICKLE1 associated with agenesis of the corpus callosum.
